name: iPhone 5 Case
description:
I designed a iPhone 5 case that took several attempts.  Too loose, too tight etc.  I have found just the right size so it fits the raw iPhone 5 frame nicely.  It takes a little breaking in initially but after a few weeks its great.   

Colors:
Each phone case is hand made for each person. If Horween has the stock you can choose from No8, Blue, Black, Whiskey, Saddle, Cigar, No 2 etc. This list goes on. Since I live near the factory I can stop in and check colors weekly.

Thread:
Red, Blue, Black, Green, Yellow, Burgundy and White.

About Horween

Ukrainian immigrant Isadore Horween founded I. Horween and Co. in 1905 in Chicago, Illinois. The city was a natural choice for many tanneries at the time due to its sizable commercial stockyard business which saw large volumes of meatpacking and processing. In 1920 the company moved to its current location on the Chicago River in Chicago's Bucktown. The company's name was eventually changed to Horween Leather Company. The company is now run by the fourth generation, with the fifth generation also in house.

Genuine Shell Cordovan is the art of tanning at its finest. More than just a color, it is a very specific leather, from a particular part of a horsehide. The irregular oval shaped shells are tanned, stuffed, shaved, and then polished – a process taking six months. Each shell is slowly steeped in gentle vegetable liquors. The shells are genuine hot stuffed then slicked onto glass frames to dry. Each shell is hand curried and shaved by highly skilled artisans to expose the shell. Dyes are hand rubbed on for a deep aniline finish. Finally, the shells are hand glazed to achieve the rich, glossy look and feel prized by fine craftsmen

name: Passport Case
description:
This is a very simple passport case.  It has two credit card slots, one large open pocket for a boarding pass and a passport sleeve pocket.  The design is so you can tightly hold the passports last page in the case so It will not fall out.  I tested it with my passport you see pictured and it was very secure.  I think traveling is complicated enough and carrying just what you need is the fastest way to get through customs.  If ordering for a trip make sure you give me at-least 3 weeks to complete.  

Colors:
Each passport case is hand made for each person.  If Horween has the stock you can choose from No8, Blue, Black, Whiskey, Saddle, Cigar, No 2 etc.  This list goes on.  Since I live near the factory I can stop in and check colors.  

Thread:
Red, Blue, Black, Green, Yellow, Burgundy and White. 

About Horween

Ukrainian immigrant Isadore Horween founded I. Horween and Co. in 1905 in Chicago, Illinois. The city was a natural choice for many tanneries at the time due to its sizable commercial stockyard business which saw large volumes of meatpacking and processing. In 1920 the company moved to its current location on the Chicago River in Chicago's Bucktown. The company's name was eventually changed to Horween Leather Company. The company is now run by the fourth generation, with the fifth generation also in house.

Genuine Shell Cordovan is the art of tanning at its finest. More than just a color, it is a very specific leather, from a particular part of a horsehide. The irregular oval shaped shells are tanned, stuffed, shaved, and then polished – a process taking six months. Each shell is slowly steeped in gentle vegetable liquors. The shells are genuine hot stuffed then slicked onto glass frames to dry. Each shell is hand curried and shaved by highly skilled artisans to expose the shell. Dyes are hand rubbed on for a deep aniline finish. Finally, the shells are hand glazed to achieve the rich, glossy look and feel prized by fine craftsmen

name: Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Wallet & Zulu Band Combo (No. 8 Shown)
description:
I custom make each wallet. I do not have any wallets in stock so everything is custom made. You pick your stamp placement or liner, leather color and thread color. I then go to the factory and purchase your shell and whatever else is needed the first week. Usually the same week if the order was placed on the weekend I start making the wallet. It takes sometimes 1-2 weeks to complete the order then add another week for shipping. International takes 5-10 days based on what USPS tells me every time I ask. So preprare to wait 3 weeks for the wallet to arrive. I have gotten wallets orders on a Monday and shipped them by Wednesday. It all depends on the day the wallet was ordered and getting to the factory.

Zulu Band
For this discounted price the Zulu band must match the shell color of the wallet.  You can choose from White, Black, Blue, Brown, Burgundy, Dark Green, Olive, Red and Yellow Irish Linen Thread.  
20mm 22mm and 24mm Available.  Black Buckles Also Available.  

Dimensions
Open: 8-1/2” Wide X 3-1/2” Tall
Closed: 4-1/2” Wide X 3-1/2” Tall
Thickness: 1/2” to 5/8” Closed and 3/16” to ¼” Open

Stamp or Lined
Since I personally visit the Horween Factory weekly to purchase the shells I can have a stamp placed wherever I desire. This also gives me the ability to choose the leather carefully. I can also line the wallet with the material of your choice. Think outside the box and combine something that is close to you. I will incorporate that into the wallet after it is mailed to me.

Irish Linen Thread
White, Black, Blue, Brown, Burgundy, Dark Green, Olive, Red and Yellow.

Shell Cordovan Colors
No. 8, No. 2, Natural, Black, Cognac, Cigar, Saddle, Whisky, Ravello, Blue and Brandy. I have access to even more colors so just ask if you know of one you like.

Styles
I basically make 2 types of standard wallets. The first is the standard 5 pocket wallet in which three pockets are on the right and two pockets are on the left. The second wallet is basically the same but I just mirror the pockets on the right for the left which creates the six pocket wallet. You pick it’s the same price.
Billfold contains 5 or 6 (you pick) card pockets and a large bill opening that fits all currencies. I hand cut and sew these wallets using a traditional saddle stitch and Irish linen thread. (4.5 in x 3.5 in x .5 in).

About Horween

Ukrainian immigrant Isadore Horween founded I. Horween and Co. in 1905 in Chicago, Illinois. The city was a natural choice for many tanneries at the time due to its sizable commercial stockyard business which saw large volumes of meatpacking and processing. In 1920 the company moved to its current location on the Chicago River in Chicago's Bucktown. The company's name was eventually changed to Horween Leather Company. The company is now run by the fourth generation, with the fifth generation also in house.

Genuine Shell Cordovan is the art of tanning at its finest. More than just a color, it is a very specific leather, from a particular part of a horsehide. The irregular oval shaped shells are tanned, stuffed, shaved, and then polished – a process taking six months. Each shell is slowly steeped in gentle vegetable liquors. The shells are genuine hot stuffed then slicked onto glass frames to dry. Each shell is hand curried and shaved by highly skilled artisans to expose the shell. Dyes are hand rubbed on for a deep aniline finish. Finally, the shells are hand glazed to achieve the rich, glossy look and feel prized by fine craftsmen

name: Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Custom NATO Band 20mm 22mm and 24mm
description:
Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Custom NATO Band 20mm 22mm and 24mm

About
If you have ever seen or worn a NATO strap you will find that the buckle lands on the 3 o'clock or 9 o'clock position depending on what wrist you wear it on. I do not like this and many other people do not as well. I designed a NATO strap that has 25% more leather so the buckle lands on the 6 o'clock position or the bottom of the wrist like a normal band. I kept the location the same for the 2 rings near the watch case so as to keep the classic look. I have to charge more because it takes more leather to make the band.   Almost a whole piece of shell cordovan has to be cut down the middle to make it for the length.  Man it looks sweet though.  Have not seen another like it yet.  

Dimensions
Available in 20mm, 22mm, and 24mm widths. 

Irish Linen Thread
White, Black, Blue, Brown, Burgundy, Dark Green, Olive, Red and Yellow.  

Shell Cordovan Colors
No. 8, No. 2, Natural, Black, Cognac, Cigar, Saddle, Whisky, Ravello, Blue and Brandy.  I have access to even more colors so just ask if you know of one you like.  

About Horween

Ukrainian immigrant Isadore Horween founded I. Horween and Co. in 1905 in Chicago, Illinois. The city was a natural choice for many tanneries at the time due to its sizable commercial stockyard business which saw large volumes of meatpacking and processing.  In 1920 the company moved to its current location on the Chicago River in Chicago's Bucktown. The company's name was eventually changed to Horween Leather Company. The company is now run by the fourth generation, with the fifth generation also in house.

Genuine Shell Cordovan is the art of tanning at its finest. More than just a color, it is a very specific leather, from a particular part of a horsehide. The irregular oval shaped shells are tanned, stuffed, shaved, and then polished – a process taking six months. Each shell is slowly steeped in gentle vegetable liquors. Dyes are hand rubbed on for a deep aniline finish. Finally, the shells are hand glazed to achieve the rich, glossy look and feel prized by fine craftsmen

name: Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Classic NATO Band 20mm 22mm and 24mm
description:
Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Classic NATO Band 20mm 22mm and 24mm

About
Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan classic NATO strap.  This is the classic NATO strap where the buckle lands on the 3 o'clock or 9 o'clock position depending on what wrist you wear it on. I make another strap where the buckle lands on the 6 o'clock position on the wrist.  It’s called the Custom NATO and cost more due to needing more leather in length. 

Dimensions
Available in 20mm, 22mm, and 24mm widths. 

Irish Linen Thread
White, Black, Blue, Brown, Burgundy, Dark Green, Olive, Red and Yellow.  

Shell Cordovan Colors
No. 8, No. 2, Natural, Black, Cognac, Cigar, Saddle, Whisky, Ravello, Blue and Brandy.  I have access to even more colors so just ask if you know of one you like.  
About Horween

Ukrainian immigrant Isadore Horween founded I. Horween and Co. in 1905 in Chicago, Illinois. The city was a natural choice for many tanneries at the time due to its sizable commercial stockyard business which saw large volumes of meatpacking and processing.  In 1920 the company moved to its current location on the Chicago River in Chicago's Bucktown. The company's name was eventually changed to Horween Leather Company. The company is now run by the fourth generation, with the fifth generation also in house.

Genuine Shell Cordovan is the art of tanning at its finest. More than just a color, it is a very specific leather, from a particular part of a horsehide. The irregular oval shaped shells are tanned, stuffed, shaved, and then polished – a process taking six months. Each shell is slowly steeped in gentle vegetable liquors. The shells are genuine hot stuffed then slicked onto glass frames to dry. Each shell is hand curried and shaved by highly skilled artisans to expose the shell. Dyes are hand rubbed on for a deep aniline finish. Finally, the shells are hand glazed to achieve the rich, glossy look and feel prized by fine craftsmen

name: Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Fountain Pen Holder
description:
Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Fountain Pen Holder

About
After searching for the perfect fountain pen case to carry my Pelikan I gave up as none of the cases worked well or carried well.   Some had large goofy flaps that were frustrating to open.   Some seemed to loose.  Others did not protect the pen from scratches or drops. So I designed my own case.  After months of using it (mine is black) I can say it’s the perfect case for me. My Pelikan fountain pen sits snug in the case. When I pull it out its easy to retrieve the pen and begin writing. I carry my pen in my pocket and it’s not noticeable at all.  

Dimensions
I will make to your fountain pen size.

Irish Linen Thread
White, Blue, Burgundy (Let me know if you have another color in mind) 

Shell Cordovan Colors
No. 8, Black and Blue (Let me know if you have another color in mind) 

About Horween

Ukrainian immigrant Isadore Horween founded I. Horween and Co. in 1905 in Chicago, Illinois. The city was a natural choice for many tanneries at the time due to its sizable commercial stockyard business which saw large volumes of meatpacking and processing.  In 1920 the company moved to its current location on the Chicago River in Chicago's Bucktown. The company's name was eventually changed to Horween Leather Company. The company is now run by the fourth generation, with the fifth generation also in house.

Genuine Shell Cordovan is the art of tanning at its finest. More than just a color, it is a very specific leather, from a particular part of a horsehide. The irregular oval shaped shells are tanned, stuffed, shaved, and then polished – a process taking six months. Each shell is slowly steeped in gentle vegetable liquors. The shells are genuine hot stuffed then slicked onto glass frames to dry. Each shell is hand curried and shaved by highly skilled artisans to expose the shell. Dyes are hand rubbed on for a deep aniline finish. Finally, the shells are hand glazed to achieve the rich, glossy look and feel prized by fine craftsmen

name: Genuine Horween Shell Cordovan Civil War Antique Bone Button Bracelet
description:
About
I found this idea searching on the web and purchased almost 100 antique bone buttons from another seller on Etsy. Its a simple bracelet made from shell cordovan about 1/2" wide. I use authentic bone buttons from the civil war era. Irish linen thread is used for the loop and also to secure the bone button. Please measure your wrist when ordering. I can also leave the thread loose so you can tie your own knot.

Dimensions
1/2 Wide x Your Desired Length

Shell Cordovan Colors
No. 8, No. 2, Natural, Black, Cognac, Cigar, Saddle, Whisky, Ravello, Blue and Brandy. I have access to even more colors so just ask if you know of one you like.
